segments.text: On Friday evening, just before Shabbat began, the door suddenly opened and a young woman made her way inside.
Leora looked at her intently, sure she knew her, but struggled to recall from where.
And suddenly, in a flash, it struck her.
A big, radiant smile spread across her face as she walked towards her and said, Noga, what a pleasant surprise!
And immediately hugged her.
Noga was a bit stunned that she knew who she was, but happily went along.
I slept in your room when I stayed with you right under your picture.
It's impossible to forget such a beautiful face," Leora explained to her.
Noga looked at her attentively, trying to learn about her beyond the stories she had heard from her parents.
They hadn't exaggerated.
She was slender with large, warm, bright blue eyes and a bit of sadness, perhaps missing Dan.
In any case, she found her charming.
No wonder she was the one he chose.
Come in.
I'll make you some coffee.
Afterwards, you'll join us for dinner.
Of course you're staying overnight, right?
Yes, Noga replied, if it's okay and there's space.
I came back from London eight months ago, a few months after my parents left again for the U.S.
Dad said you haven't been in touch for a long time.
He said he tried calling several times but there was no answer.
Finally, just before they left, he wrote you a letter to the pink house.
You remembered you said the letters arrive even without an address.
I hope you got it.
They miss you, but they were caught up in their own worries.
We're all living in this uncertainty that's killing us.
Dad suggested several times that I visit you and even explained exactly how to get here.
And today in the afternoon, I felt an overwhelming loneliness and suddenly I found myself coming to you.
She looked excitedly at Dan's sister wanting to tell her.
You are my family.
But before she could say anything, a voice called from the garden, and through the open glass door, little Ben-Ben toddled in.
His black curls danced with each step as usual, and he smiled at her broadly, proudly showing her his dirty hands, indicating he needed them cleaned.
Noga looked at the sweet baby with her mouth open, and immediately knew she was seeing a little Dan.
Only his eyes were blue like his mother's.
She lifted her eyes to her and tears welled up in both of their eyes from the emotion of the moment.
My God, it's unbelievable how much he looks like him.
Why didn't you tell mom and dad?
They would have gone crazy with joy.
Ben Ben glanced at the new guest with a big smile and showed her his dirty hands from playing in the garden.
Do you want Aunt Noga to wash your hands?"
Leora asked him.
He nodded, and Noga lifted him in her arms, walked with him to the bathroom, marked with a small sign, and washed his small hands.
Then she put him on his feet and dried his hands well.
When they finished, he suddenly hugged her leg, as if to say thank you.
Noga was overwhelmed.
If only her brother knew what was waiting for him here when he returns, an entire world of love and warmth.
She immediately felt that the boy wasn't shy of strangers, having grown up in a hotel where new people arrive daily.
And presumably, everyone is delighted with him.
There's no doubt that Leora is raising him with freedom and a lot of love.
All the while, Leora watched this closeness between her son and his new aunt, and knew that at this moment, her family had grown.
Late at night, Ben-Ben slept on the small mattress at the entrance to the kitchen.
He simply went to the mattress, laid down his head, and fell asleep.
I've never met such a calm baby.
He's just an amazing little creature," Noga said.
Like his father, Leora replied with a smile.
Hours went by as they continued to talk.
Look, Noga, you need to understand that I found out I was pregnant only midway through my third month, and Dan hadn't been around for a while.
I had to listen to my heart.
I knew I couldn't have an abortion.
That this child was the result of great love, and as I deal with many complex things, I'll deal with this too.
In my heart, I hoped it's what he would have wanted.
Something strange happens to me.
I communicate with him in my dreams.
He talks to me, asks me to trust him.
not to give up on him and to wait patiently a bit longer.
I see him in a Spanish-speaking country with very simple colonial houses, sitting at a local café with a bit of a worn-out beret, looking like a completely different man, and only I know it's him.
And suddenly he lifts his head and looks deep into my eyes as if asking me to wait, as if saying just a bit more.
This whole situation wasn't simple.
Luckily, no one noticed anything about me.
By the time I was discharged, I was already seven months along and my doctor helped me with his friend who manages the maternity ward here.
As soon as I felt strong contractions, he called him to the hospital.
And the friend delivered me in what he said was the easiest birth I've ever seen in my life.
I felt that someone was watching over me from above, that my mom, knowing she can't be with me, ensured it wouldn't hurt too much, that it would pass easily.
It was so quick and I didn't make a sound.
And suddenly he placed him on me, and this little one opened a pair of large blue eyes from a face that was all Dan.
In my heart, I talked to Dan.
I told him he had a son that looks like him, exactly, and I immediately knew that would be his name, Ben.
And Ben-Ben, this child, understands that it's hard for his mom and he's just a little miracle.
It's as if he's here to ease my loneliness and longing for his father, and we both wait together, and together it's always easier than alone.
I had many hesitations about Naomi and David.
I became so attached to them in such a short time, and your father even visited me here just before I knew for sure I was pregnant.
I didn't know how they would take it, and I admit I was a bit embarrassed too.
Perhaps in hindsight, I should have told them immediately.
But by the time I decided to go to them, it turned out they had left and it was too late.
You have no idea how happy I am that you're here.
It feels like I've suddenly gained a sister and my family has grown.
Noga hugged her.
I feel the same, she said.
I miss him so much.
It's been over two years since I saw him.
You know, one of the last times I saw him, he came to my place by the sea to look for me.
We sat there cuddled, and suddenly he gathered my hair and braided a perfect braid, Leora told her.
I was very surprised by his skill, and he said that when you were little, Naomi taught him to braid your hair, and that he missed you a lot.
She sighed and leaned back in the chair.
There are days when my strength leaves me and the longing and uncertainty are so hard that I almost break.
But then I hold Ben Ben close or sit at the piano and pour out everything in my heart and it gives me a little more strength to continue.
I too had great love in London for an English guy.
Noga suddenly said, that's why I delayed coming back.
I was already sure I would live there for the rest of my life.
I joined a good and respected local dance troupe.
And he managed a small French theater, a charming guy, full of content and knowledge who enveloped me entirely for a long period.
Then one day I wasn't feeling well and came home in the middle of the day.
And there he was, in our room, with one of the young actresses from the theater, someone completely new.
I don't even know if he knew her name.
Quietly, I closed the door, left the house and sat on the steps at the entrance, feeling that my legs couldn't hold me.
Within two minutes, she burst out, not noticing me, and ran off.
A minute later, he came out to only in his pants, his legs bare, and he was crying.
He begged me to forgive him, saying he didn't know what happened to him and how he was tempted by this foolishness.
And I looked at this man whom I love so deeply just five minutes before.
And suddenly he felt completely foreign to me.
I didn't know who he was.
I only knew clearly one thing.
I wanted to go home now at that moment.
It took me half an hour to pack all my things into two suitcases, book a plane ticket, and that same night I returned home.
Only from here did I quit my job over the phone, and since then I've been here.
For two months he kept calling and writing, trying to convince me.
Until he realized there was no point, and I'm fine, I'm calm, content with my decision, and know that one day I will find the one I can trust forever.
Leora was astonished by Noga's story, how much heartbreak she endured,
And perhaps it's for the best.
If not with this one, it would have occurred with another.
How strange, she said to Noga, this is what Dan asks for in dreams that I trust him.
Noga stayed with them for three days, refusing to leave.
Insisting on sharing their sleeping mattress.
And so, Ben Ben slept between his mother and his aunt.
And every morning when he opened his eyes, a wide smile spread across his lips.
Know me and my dear dad, Noga wrote to her parents.
I don't even know where to start.
I took dad's advice and reached Dan's girlfriend at her pink house.
She recognized me immediately from the picture she saw in my room and enveloped me in a big hug.
I so understand why he chose her.
She is exactly as you described, slender with a pair of giant blue eyes with a warm heart shining through them.
She immediately explained that there was no question about it and that I was staying over.
You'll eat with us for dinner.

I hadn't even had time to wonder what with us, she meant, when suddenly a sweet baby, all little Dan, toddled in from the garden, stretched out both dirty hands to me with great tried, without realizing it, I said, Do you want Aunt Noga to wash your hands?
Just like that, in a second, without hesitating, I said, Aunt Noga.
He's not even ten months old and already proudly walks and babbles a few words.
Oh, my beloveds, if you could see this amazing creature that is all our Dan, including his black curls, only his eyes are blue like his mother's.
I can't imagine what she's been through and how she deals with it all alone.
She's a superhero, this girl.
I'm sending you a picture of Ben then, so you can see that a miracle happened to us.
Our brother better hurry back.
He has so much to return for.
Sending you a huge hug and one from her too.
Noga.
